intro: Baphia klainei, commonly known as the African sarsaparilla, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Leguminosae family and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that are followed by pod-like fruits containing several seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded areas of rainforests and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological and pharmacological studies.
